captions.text:
Ye have heard that it hath been
said, An eye for an eye,

and a tooth for a tooth: but I
say unto you, That ye resist

not evil: but whosoever
shall smite thee

Master, this woman was taken in
adultery, in the very act.

Now Moses in the law commanded
us, that such should be

He that is without sin among
you, let him first cast a

Woman, where are those
thine accusers?

Neither do I condemn thee:
go, and sin no more.

comments.text:
Not every one that saith unto me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom 
of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven.﻿
comments.author: tiffanyteddybearz

comments.text:
Jesus does not say in this scripture that He forgives this woman for her 
sins. He tells her that He does not punish her by stoning. He tells her to 
not sin again. That is all. Forgiveness only comes to those who believe 
Jesus is the Son of God and Savior, that repent, are baptized in His name, 
keep His commandments, and endure to the end. Forgiveness comes with a 
price. Then His grace saves us.﻿
comments.author: tiffanyteddybearz

comments.text: dude, this is cool﻿

This is one of my favorite stories in the bible it basically shows that god

loves and forgives. ﻿

comments.text:
The world is quick to find fault with what they don't understand
They seek to destroy the very essence of intelligence and empathy
Therefore they dwell in a dark place where the truth and light of Knowledge 
can not dwell 
They are Full of there own imaginings
They follow the vain thing of the world
and seek not the Glory of the everlasting kingdom of Choice
Where in, all are made free from bondage 
This is the Love of the Father which is in The heavens above you
 to his Dear little children
To bring to past the immortality of Man and all of his Glories
   Inside us is the greatest power in the Universe
Just under this temporal shell of Flesh and Bone
Is the greatest power in the universe
YOU!

To be in his image 
As children we grow from Grace to Grace
without this empathy I speak of
Grace cannot attend you
Be ye therefore gentle to one another and Fathers Compassions toward Us, 
will increase
In this we are made whole as one Family 
The Family of Man

There really isn't any other way
The wise Men and women of the world have always had the same sound
Therefore, they being two in capabilities 
But one in purpose
They are as one
United
What power this brings
to bring the many talents and virtues and courage
Into one union
With one heart towards truth and Love

This is Zion  "To have all things in common"
for a common unity

Is that where we got the word from?


 



  
 ﻿
comments.author: C E Mason

comments.text: He is very smart ﻿
comments.author: maurice4680

comments.text:
What about the guy with whom this lady was committing adultery with? Where 
is he? And why didn't the Pharisees condemn him also? Every time I hear 
this story I can't help but wonder. ﻿
comments.author: Troy Davis

comments.text:
I agree this is one of Christ's best sermons, for who is without sin? I 
loved how he lifted her up, and beckoned her lovingly to go her way and 
basically told her to repent by saying "sin no more". Truly beautiful and 
exemplifies the personality of the Lord, our Savior.﻿
comments.author: Lori Madsen

comments.text: Praise the Lord!!!﻿
comments.author: Kristopher Martin

comments.text:
What struck me for the first time while watching this is that Christ isn't 
saying that adultery isn't a serious sin. He isn't saying that because 
everyone sins its ok. I think He's trying to convey that only He has the 
authority to judge, condemn and forgive sin. Only He and those He ordains 
have the authority to judge in things like this.
And look - He forgives her.﻿
comments.author: Karen Hess

comments.text:
Simple isn't it? Sin no more. Thank you Jesus for taking my chains and sins 
away from me.﻿

comments.author: Daniel Conteh

comments.text:
I think people sometimes miss the point to this amazing story. When Jesus 
told her to go and sin no more, he knew she would continue to sin and make 
mistakes. The act of forgiving, not judging and loving her in-spite of her 
sins, is what we need to pay attention to. ﻿
comments.author: halflife352011

comments.text:
+Lori Madsen Plus, How could they condem her when they just let the man go 
his way?
They caught them in the "very act" they said and the law demanded that they 
BOTH be brought before . . . .
comments.author: Johnny Rudick

comments.text:
I think there is that, but the most important message he said was where are 
thine accusers?  None condemn thee, neither do I condemn thee; go thou way 
and sin no more. I think basically he was telling her to repent, and have 
that mighty change of heart. Christ expects us to repent, and tells us all 
to go our way and sin no more. When we make mistakes or fall from grace, he 
beckons us to come back to him, and sin no more.  Repentance is not a once 
in a lifetime event. We must have a repentant heart daily, realizing where 
we are not  keeping a commandment or commandments.  He wants our whole 
hearts, minds and souls.
comments.author: Lori Madsen

comments.text:
Yes, my thought also was that maybe it just wasn't found in those scripts. 
Maybe it was passed down and recorded later. Either way, I remember a

mention of such an idea. I've always wondered about it since.

comments.text:
This parable is a good example for grace versus law. As per law, nobody 
eligible to be treated as righteous[ Romans3=23] and Gal 2=16.That is why, 
Jesus came to pay penalty for our sins[pro.16=6] .Hence he is empowered to 
forgive sins.After forgiveness, we should not commit sin and live new 
life.May GOD help us to live new transformed life.
comments.author: VenuGopalReddy Sannala

una mis escrituras favorita , no porque sea mujer o por lo que ella hiso ,

y solo nos dijo : vete y no peques mas !!!

comments.author: robertwarrior

comments.text:
According to the Law (Torah), to accuse someone of breaking the Law, there 
must be 2 witnesses. If you falsely accuse somebody of breaking the Law, 
then you will receive that punishment the accused was to receive. In this 
case the punishment for adultery was death by stoning. What did Jesus 
Christ write in the sand? Where were the 2 witnesses to testify against the 
woman? When Jesus challenged them, they retreated because they knew they 
had falsely accused the woman. There were not 2 witnesses.
comments.author: louise ridder

comments.text:
One thing I learned this past Sunday at church (mothers day) was that 
calling someone "woman" was great praise. Almost like calling her queen. He 
called Mary "woman" after being resurrected. It shows me that although we 
al make mistakes we are all still children of our Father in Heaven and have 
the potential to be like him if we repent and come unto him.
